A ChimeSDKVoice SIP Media Application is a managed object that passes values from a SIP rule to a target AWS Lambda function.

<div><pulumi-examples>

    <dd>A bag of options that control this resource's behavior.</dd>
</dl>

</pulumi-choosable>

<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#lambda_arn_python" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">lambda_<wbr>arn</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">str</span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>Valid Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Lambda function, version, or alias. The function must be created in the same AWS Region as the SIP media application.</p>
</dd></dl>
</pulumi-choosable>
</div>

<div>
<pulumi-choosable type="language" values="yaml">
<dl class="resources-properties"><dt class="property-required"
            title="Required">
        <span id="lambdaarn_yaml">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#lambdaarn_yaml" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">lambda<wbr>Arn</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">String</span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>Valid Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Lambda function, version, or alias. The function must be created in the same AWS Region as the SIP media application.</p>
</dd></dl>
</pulumi-choosable>
</div>

## Import



Using `pulumi import`, import a ChimeSDKVoice SIP Media Application using the `id`. For example:

```sh
 $ pulumi import aws:chime/sdkvoiceSipMediaApplication:SdkvoiceSipMediaApplication example abcdef123456
```
